ratings.comment: This class is very difficult, but Dr. Porter is very willing to help. Attend his office hours and work in groups. A few homework assignments plus two take home exams. He is the best professor I have ever had!His jokes and laugh make the class easier to get through! After my second semester with Dr. Porter I highly recommend taking a class with him!

Dr. Porter is an extremely humble professor. He is very approachable and really wants his students to succeed. As long as you come to class and participate you will get an A. Only warning, he did not give out any grades the entire semester so it was hard to judge your work. Take this class, its very interesting and he's awesome!

He is a pretty boring lecturer but I don't agree with previous people saying he is hard. His exam was fair and was not as hard as the other lecturers. Just take notes in lecture and study them and study the book, you'll do great.

He was pretty unhelpful overall, and the lectures were very disorganized. I went to talk with him once during office hours because I was interested in environmental science (supposedly his area), asked about what courses would be good to take. He just laughed and said he couldn't really help me and gave me no advice at all.
His tests do not match what he teaches or the book very well. He is a nice guy but very poor lecturer. You can drop one midterm in this class and it's bc everyone does so bad on his.

no point in trying to understand his powerpoint slides. whenever he talks about pesticides, WRITE IT DOWN. a lot of stuff on exams he didn't even talk about in lectures. he's not the worst professor but other 2 are better
The bad news, Dr. Porter only cares about pesticides and can't teach to save his life. The good news, you can drop one of the three midterms, so just do well on the other lecturer's exams.

Porter is not a good lecturer.  His slides are confusing and he gets very specific about names.  He lied to my face about what would be on the exam.  I went to his office hours for help and just added more info that was useless and doesn't teach well.  If this class is required do good on the previous 2 exams because his is the hardest by far.
Not a bad guy, but very vague, and doesn't teach to the intentions of the class.  Very helpful if you talk to him but still has some exam questions that feel like they come out of left field.
Warren is so nice! If you go to office hours, he'll be a great help. Yes the class is challenging, but that is what we came to college for!!

His lectures are boring and hard to take good notes for. Rambles incessantly about pesticides.  Exam was more difficult than the others and also disorganized. With the structure of this class, it's recommended to just not try during his section, as his exam will be the one you drop unless if you study harder than you do with the other lecturers.

Professor Porter is extremely friendly and loves what he does, he just over-complicates his lectures by using big words related to biology, and then saying we don't need to know that. Lectures somewhat followed the book... Exams were tough.

This class is way too difficult to be an elemtary rated course.  I studied hard, read the text, and I still barely managed to get a C.  What frustrated me the most was that he gave the test and then 2 weeks after found questions that didn't have answers.  If he doesn't know the material, how can you?
He is very vague in Lecture, but the material is interesting and he puts a lot of his information on his slides, which is a really good review.

Couldn't pay attention in class what so ever. I am majoring in biology and honestly didn't learn one single thing in his lectures. I had to teach myself everything from the book which resulted in a terrible midterm grade since he was so vague on everything he taught. if you are taking a bio 101, be warned, you need to work extra hard!!!
Difficult to follow at times. His notes are simply unlabeled diagrams which require you to figure it out.  Funny jokes but you need to be self-motivated to have him teach you.

He is a terrible teacher and constantly got off subject and started talking about either his wife or pesticides.  It was very hard to know what material we were supposed to be focusing on because of this.
Puts you right to sleep. All his material is scattered throughout the book so no need to pay attention anyway

Porter is by far the worst of the 101 professors! He is super vague about what we need to know and what we need to write down. It's useful to have a laptop for his lectures in order to try to get more of his ramblings down. This also means you don't have to print off the full 20 pages of slides he had for some of his lectures. watch the animations!

Because Thoma's slides were so organized, it was a hard transition to Porter's lecture style. He's a really nice guy and helps you A LOT if you come in for office hours/schedule an appointment, but his lectures are very confusing and you NEED you laptop if you want to take good notes. Go to the book to add information to the slides from class.

Really sweet old guy, but a little clueless. He is such a confusing lecturer, and clearly doesn't understand that this is an intro course. He doesn't give any definitions and you basically have to go back over every lecture slide and find the info in the book. Makes everything so difficult to understand.

He seems like a nice guy, but he's probably the worst professor I've ever had. He rambles about pesticides for most of the lecture, and then shouts a few important things at you after the bell rings. It's hard to tell what is important and what isn't.

Hard to follow with all the tangents and throat clearing.  Covers topics way too advanced for Zoo 101. Just avoid this class at all costs. Fulfill your BioSci some other way. It's not worth your time.

Um. Well. Not a whole lot more to say. Other than he's incredibly entertaining to watch. But he goes off on tangents a lot... so it's really unclear what is and what isn't going to be on the exam... Watch your back.

Have/had him for the last lecturer in ZOO 101...He is hard to understand and follow. Printing off slides is annoying because his ppt slides have repeats. Clears voice constantly..old..hard to follow.  TA even said he is teaching topics way too advance for intro level course and doesn't define anything. Not a good prof for first years.

I had him as one of my three profs for zoo 101. He's a smart guy and likes to relate the course to his specification. Warren is very grandfather-like and has a soothing voice that is easy to fall asleep to. Lectures are pretty decent, some tests questions can be tricky. Overall, a solid professor.

He is not the easiest to understand, however, he is the nicest person I have ever met.  If you don't understand something do and see him.  He will go out of his way to make it okay for you.  Never met an instructor with less ego and more heart.

Don't be so hard on Porter. His lectures aren't that bad, his power point slides are confusing because they are all pictures. If you just go over what he talks about in the book and use your common sense it will be fine. His test questions were not hard.

When this man lectures, you might as well bring a pillow to class. Not only are his lectures boring but his test questions are near impossible. He clears his throat at least ten times in a two minute period. prepare to be frustrated.
very boring voice, keeps clearing his throat, not very clear

He knows his stuff, but is a poor teacher. The lectures are done with PowerPoint, a lot of graphics and very few notes, so attending lecture is a must. Exams are difficult, mainly because his questions are worded poorly.

Porter is way too smart for the rest of us, which is why it is understandable that he's difficult to take classes from. However, the man is the most generous, understanding man who will make the time for you. If you take Zoo 504, be sure to work in groups and make this class your family. He encourages it.
Feeds a lot of information at once
No Comments

Incredibly boring. I was surprised to find myself struggling to stay awake in a class that I really liked the rest of. After lecture, you feel like you know nothing. Go to discussion! For how detailed his lectures were, his test questions were very easy. I was convinced I was getting a C after his lectures were over, but got an AB. The curve helps!

Porter often went very in-depth in lecture, true, but his test was the easiest of the three professors. Just get the general concepts that thyroid hormone is crucial, and that pesticides are bad, and you'll do fine. He can ramble sometimes, but don't worry if you don't understand his millions of diagrams. They're not all that important in the end.

After reading Porter's bad reviews, I was surprised to find that he wound up being my favorite of the 3 professors.  He's clear, he's passionate about what he's teaching, and he actually goes slow enough to understand him (unlike Steudal.) Also, I thought he wrote the fairest test questions of the 3 profs.  No trick questions.  DO NOT BE AFRAID!!

Porter is such a nice guy. He really makes an effort to get to know his students (which is impressive in a lecture of over 400). However, he is far too overqualified to be teaching this course. He skips over a lot of the introductory stuff and goes right to extreme detail. My best advice is GO TO DISCUSSION, or else you'll die.

Be prepared to teach yourself the info. Porter likes to paste a lot of pictures from the book but he doesn't explain them well. You'll have to refer back to the book and go to a TA's discussion. Honestly, his toxicology info was really interesting and he really is passionate with what he does...this part isn't too bad. However his test is TORTURE!!

Dr. Porter is extremely intelligent and interesting, however, he expects a lot out of his students, as he should. Lectures can be confusing, but he is always there to chat with students and help, and knowing the jist of what he wants you to know is easy.

WORST professor I have ever had! He CANNOT teach an introductory course- he goes into super useless detail when we don't even learn the basics. His slides are all pictures with little straightforward information. Horrible lecturer who complained about pesticides and evil politicians EVERY DAY. DO NOT TAKE ZOO 101!! Porter is horrible!

Porter is a nice guy, however, if you could stay awake in that class I would consider giving you money.  So boring to listen to.  Only diagrams every appear on his slides and it is almost impossible to understand whats going on.  Have fun with this guy.
Definetely the worst of the 3 profs for this class. His slides are mostly pictures and diagrams, no words so it's hard to follow him in lecture. Expect to have to put a lot of extra work in yourself.
I never understood what he was talking about in class... his lecture slides are just diagrams and he can be VERY confusing..... nice guy though
Horribly hard exams, clears his throat LOUDLY all the time, hard to stay awake, seems to take interest in his students and loves to answer questions...least fav prof ever
Hard exam.  not nearly as good as the other 2 prof. before him.  boooo i got a 'C' in this class because of the final AND i cried.

I think Dr. Porter is just too smart to teach an intro Bio course. I felt like I had to self-teach myself everything he covered in his lectures because I couldn't understand what he was talking about during lecture. VERY hard exam.
It's zoology 101: animal biology, not zoology 101: effects of pesticides on humans. I'm glad he likes promoting his cause, but don't do it every lecture.
seems like he is very interested in his students and wants to know us... although class has become soo boring, although the coughing helps to wake you up
the MOST BORING professor ever.  exams suck.  class is hard.  i hated every minute of this class.  that's all i can say.

I agree with the previous post - he's a genuine guy and deserves to be heard.  I think the best thing for his section is to simply not get caught up and taking all the notes and listen.  Read the book as ancillary material.  Not the best lecturer, but easily not the worst. Good guy.
I disliked him as a teacher, although I think he is a genuine person and deserves to be heard. He was often unclear and presented jumbled lectures... read the book... ha ha ha I got an A :)

Worst of the 3 professors.  Went to the first two of his lectures and then didn't go the rest of the semester.  I just read the book instead.  Seems like a nice guy but the throat clearing is EXTREMELY distracting.  The course is difficult but the curve does help.

Porter is a very nice guy but doesn't know how to explain everything he wants to say.  His lectures are very confusing and his slides have too much information on them to take notes.  If you have him make sure you read the book along with the lectures.  That will really help.

Porter's section of the course was extremely difficult.  Went to lecture but it was not very helpful. I had to take my own notes from the book in order to understand.  Test questions from him were very difficult.  Spends about half the time talking about his area of research: how bad pesticides are.

BOOOOORRRRRING, worst prof out of the 3 that taught thru-out the semester EH HEM clears his throat at LEAST 50 times a minute EH HEM, all he shows is pictures and speaks in terms he thinks people understand...extremely hard to follow
this guy should teach philosophy, not zoology.
too many pictures, not enough explanation. seems like a really nice guy. tests were much harder than expected.
The throat clearing is beyond distracting.  Too much information and not enough explanation makes the class much harder then it needs to be.  Completely frustrating.
I didn't enjoy this class especially when it was his turn to teach.  very very boring...lots of information with no help about what takes priority.
very boring.
BORING!! get ready for monotone lectures filled with lots of throat clearing...
He is a funny guy but it is impossible to know what he wants you to learn.

Lectures were very erratic, little actual teaching went on, but exam questions expected you to know a lot more.  Even with pre-printed Power Point slides it was tough to follow.  Find a good TA, go to optional discussions, otherwise you're basically lost.
He's not straight forward but he's a nice guy.  Nice guy...terrible teacher.  How can he be such a bad teacher?!
Could possibly be the worst lecturer in the University.  This also could be the worst intro. class in the University as well.
Very boring and too many visual aids w/o focusing on main topic

Not like Raffetto & Steudel. Visual aides, memorizing people who've done studies. Seems to care but hasn't changed much after I & others have asked him to do fewer visual aides and more telling us what we absolutely need to know.
Makes no sense during lecture, expects memorization of stupid visual aids.
Could have been worse.......
*clear throat*  His teaching style * clear throat* is all about *clear throat* visual aids. *ahem* Really confusing during lecture and sends us a lot *clear throat* of useless e-mails.
